page.title: 03The Cliffs
page.content: If you go to the South end of the village you can walk along the cliffs. Here is the most easterly farm in the British Isles. You will notice the wooden sea defences along the beach preventing coastal erosion.You can still see the remains of cottages which have fallen into the sea.Beach angling is very popular along this strip of coast during winter months, as is fishing from small boats. The species most commonly caught are cod,whiting, and dabs. There are a number of different birds to be seen along this coast.Among those to look out for are - sand martins black-headed gulls, herring gulls, little terns, common tern, dunlins, guillimots, oyster catchers, skylarks, yellow hammers, goldfinches, kestrels, swallows, house martins and lapwings.
